private_information: I am allowed to move disks: A, B, C, D
I can only move one disk at a time and must respect the Tower of Hanoi rules
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves so the final configuration has left: [A,E,F,G,H,I,J] top-to-bottom, middle: [C,D], right: [B]

private_information: I am allowed to move disks: E, F, G
I must respect the Tower of Hanoi rules
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves so the final configuration has left: [A,E,F,G,H,I,J] top-to-bottom, middle: [C,D], right: [B]

private_information: I am allowed to move disks: H, I, J
I must respect the Tower of Hanoi rules
agent_3.goal: Contribute moves so the final configuration has left: [A,E,F,G,H,I,J] top-to-bottom, middle: [C,D], right: [B]

private_information: I coordinate the agents and produce the final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward
orchestrator.goal: Assemble agents' proposals and produce a final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward that encodes the Tower of Hanoi instance and the cooperative plan

public_information: Classic Tower of Hanoi rules apply: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
There are three pegs named left, middle, right.
Disks are strictly ordered by size A < B < C < D < E < F < G < H < I < J, where A is smallest and J largest.
Initial configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J; middle and right pegs empty.
Goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A,E,F,G,H,I,J; middle peg top-to-bottom C,D; right peg top-to-bottom B.
Agent move permissions: agent_1 may move A,B,C,D; agent_2 may move E,F,G; agent_3 may move H,I,J.

generate_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi task. You may move only disks A, B, C, D. Using the public information and your private permissions, produce an ordered list of primitive moves you will perform. Each move must be in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and do not move disks you are not permitted to move.
generate_moves.prompt: Context: public information {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will execute, following the required format.

generate_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi task. You may move only disks E, F, G. Using the public information and your private permissions, indicate any primitive moves you will perform. Each move must be in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and avoid moving disks you are not permitted to move.
generate_moves.prompt: Context: public information {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will execute, following the required format. If you have no moves to perform, return an empty list.

generate_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3 in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi task. You may move only disks H, I, J. Using the public information and your private permissions, indicate any primitive moves you will perform. Each move must be in the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and avoid moving disks you are not permitted to move.
generate_moves.prompt: Context: public information {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_3->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_3->goal}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will execute, following the required format. If you have no moves to perform, return an empty list.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator responsible for integrating agents' proposed primitive moves and producing a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward planner. Combine the agents' move lists, keep each agent's actions distinct, and produce a PDDL domain and problem that encode the Tower of Hanoi instance and allow verification or reproduction of the cooperative plan. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: You will receive move lists from agents and public environment information. Integrate those moves into a correct multi-agent PDDL encoding for FastDownward. Keep agent actions distinct and ensure that the PDDL domain and problem capture the initial state, the goal configuration, and the legality constraints. Use the agents' moves as guidance and resolve any inconsistencies if necessary. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>.

reference_solution: agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk C from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk B from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk D from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk B from right to left
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk C from right to middle
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk B from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
